name: emcare
title: Extended Codes CodeSystem
description: Set of codes identified as being needed but not found in existing Code Systems

concept.definition: Unique identifier provided or a universal ID, if used in the country

concept.display: Child's Identity unknown/prefer to remain anonymous
concept.definition: The client's identity is unknown or the client's prefers to remain anonymous

Client's family name or last name

concept.definition: The client is reported to have or has had pain or difficulty passing urine or crying when passing urine

concept.display: Unable to perform test - assumes vomits everything/unable to drink
concept.definition: The health care worker is unable to perform test on the client therefore the health care worker should assume the client vomits everything or is unable to drink
The client passes the fluid test

concept.display: Goes back very slowly (More than 2 seconds)
concept.definition: The client's skin goes back very slowly after skin pinch of abdomen (More than 2 seconds)

concept.display: Goes back slowly (2 seconds or fewer, but not immediately)
concept.definition: The client's skin goes back slowly after skin pinch of abdomen (2 seconds or fewer, but not immediately)
The client's skin goes back normally after skin pinch of abdomen (immediately)
The client has Skin Lesions ≥ 4 cm
The client has red skin streaks
The client has tender nodes (nodules) under the skin that can appear on any part of the face or body
The client has skin infection that extends to muscle

concept.display: Molluscum Contagiosum - Skin coloured pearly white papules with central umbilication. Most commonly seen on face and trunk in children.
concept.definition: The client has Molluscum Contagiosum - Skin coloured pearly white papules with central umbilication. Most commonly seen on face and trunk in children.

concept.display: Warts - Papules or nodules with a rough (Verrucous) surface
concept.definition: The client has Warts - Papules or nodules with a rough (Verrucous) surface

concept.display: Seborrhoea - Greasy scales and redness on central face and body folds
concept.definition: The client has Seborrhoea - Greasy scales and redness on central face and body folds

concept.display: Fixed Drug Reactions - Generalised red, wide spread with small bumps or blisters; or one or more dark skin areas
concept.definition: The client has Fixed Drug Reactions - Generalised red, wide spread with small bumps or blisters; or one or more dark skin areas

concept.display: Eczema - Wet oozing sores or excoriated, thick patches
concept.definition: The client has Eczema - Wet oozing sores or excoriated, thick patches
The client has Steven Johnson Syndrome
The client has had pus draining from the ear for less than 14 days
The client has had pus draining from the ear for 14 days or more
The client has a generalised skin problem
The client has a localised skin problem
The client does not have a generalised or localised skin problem
The client has an abscess - Hot tender swelling
The client has an abscess that is deep or extends to muscle
The client has Cellulitis - Red tender skin

concept.display:
Papular Itching Rash
(Prurigo) - Itching rash with small papules and scratch marks. Dark spots with pale centre
concept.definition:
The client has Papular Itching Rash
(Prurigo) - itching rash with small papules and scratch marks. Dark spots with pale centre

concept.display:
Ringworm (Tinea) - An itchy circular lesion with a raised edge and fine 
scaly area in the centre with loss of hair.  May also be found on body or web on feet
concept.definition:
The client has Ringworm (Tinea) - An itchy circular lesion with a raised edge and fine 
scaly area in the centre with loss of hair.  May also be found on body or web on feet

concept.display: Scabies - Rash and excoriations on torso; burrows in web space and wrists, face spared
concept.definition: The client has Scabies - Rash and excoriations on torso; burrows in web space and wrists, face spared

concept.display: Chickenpox - Vesicles over body.  Vesicles appear progressively over days and form scabs after they rupture
concept.definition: The client has Chickenpox - Vesicles over body.  Vesicles appear progressively over days and form scabs after they rupture

concept.display:
Herpes Zoster -  Vesicles in one area on one side of body with intense pain or scars plus shooting pain.  
Uncommon in children except where they are immuno-compromised (e.g. if infected with HIV)
concept.definition:
The client has Herpes Zoster -  Vesicles in one area on one side of body with intense pain or scars plus shooting pain.  
Uncommon in children except where they are immuno-compromised (e.g. if infected with HIV)

concept.display: Impetigo or Folliculitis - Red, Tender, Warm Crusts or Small lesions
concept.definition: The client has Impetigo or Folliculitis - Red, Tender, Warm Crusts or Small lesions
nan

concept.definition: The client has mouth sores or mouth ulcers that are deep and extensive

concept.display: Movement only when stimulated but then stops
concept.definition: The client has movement but only when stimulated and then movement stops

concept.display: Moves on his or her own or moves spontaneously or without stimulation
concept.definition: The client moves on his or her own or moves spontaneously or without stimulation

concept.definition: The client's Jaundice appeared less than 24 hours after birth
The client's Jaundice appeared 24 hours or more after birth

The client has not been stabilised and the healthcare worker willend the consultation
